results.title: Asparagus and Pea Soup: Real Convenience Food
results.summary: You can never have too many soup recipes, so give Asparagus and Pea Soup: Real Convenience Food a try. For $3.24 per serving, this recipe covers 25% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 240 calories, 11g of protein, and 8g of fat. This recipe from fullbellysisters.blogspot.com has 204 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 20 minutes. It will be a hit at your Autumn event. If you have onion, peas, a couple of garlic cloves, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 96%. This score is spectacular. Try Butternut Squash & Pear Soup: Real Convenience Food, Tomato, Cucumber & Onion Salad with Feta Cheese: Real Convenience Food, and Everyday Granola from Real Food, Real Simple for similar recipes.

steps.step: Chop the garlic and onions.
Saute the onions in the EVOO, adding the garlic after a couple of minutes; cook until the onions are translucent.

Add the whole bag of asparagus and cover everything with the broth. Season with salt and pepper and a pinch of red pepper flakes, if using.Simmer until the asparagus is bright green and tender (if you've thawed the asparagus it will only take a couple of minutes). Turn off the heat and puree using an immersion blender.

Add peas (the heat of the soup will quickly thaw them) and puree until smooth; add more until it reaches the thickness you like.Top with chives and a small dollop of creme fraiche or sour cream or greek yogurt.

results.title: Instant Pot Quinoa Grain Bowl
results.summary: If you have about 13 minutes to spend in the kitchen, Instant Pot Quinoa Grain Bowl might be an awesome gluten free, dairy free, lacto ovo vegetarian, and vegan recipe to try. One portion of this dish contains around 15g of protein, 9g of fat, and a total of 400 calories. For $2.03 per serving, you get a main course that serves 4. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. It is brought to you by Pink When. Head to the store and pick up kale, stock, salt and pepper, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the avocado you could follow this main course with the chocolate avocado mousse | quick dark chocolate avocado mousse as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 94%, this dish is spectacular. Similar recipes include Instant Pot Sausage Cabbage Bowl with Quinoa (or Stovetop), Crock Pot Chicken Fajita Bowl (Grain-Free, Paleo), and Instant Pot Quinoa Pilaf.

steps.step: Rinse and drain the quinoa to remove the bitter and sometimes mildly soapy taste that can linger if not rinsed.
Combine the quinoa, stock and seasonings in the Instant Pot together and then twist to lock the lid shut. Set the pot to Manual for 1 minute.
At the end of the cook time, let the pot to natural pressure release for 10 minutes before carefully releasing the remaining pressure.
Fluff the cooked quinoa with a fork. Now you have Instant Pot Quinoa!
Add fruits and vegetables over a scoop of cooked quinoa and make an amazing quinoa grain bowl.

steps.step: Place the fresh basil, avocado, garlic, cashews, and sea salt into a food processor and blitz until everything is smooth, scraping down the sides occasionally.While the food processor is running, add in the water 1 tbsp at a time until you have a creamy pesto.Cook whole wheat spaghetti according to package instructions.
Drain the pasta, toss with pesto, serve with a little extra fresh basil and Parmesan.

steps.step: Cut all vegetables into chunks and place in a food processor or a large bowl.
Add bread, water, garlic, olive oil, vinegar, and salt.Using a food processor or a hand blender blend until the soup is smooth.

Serve in a bowl/jar/glass with some ice cubes.
